paper.title: Unsolvable Decision Problems for Prolog Programs
paper.venue: Computation Theory and Logic, In Memory of Dieter Rödding
paper.abstract: The paper presents a general method by which various natural decision problems for programs in PROLOG and extensions of PROLOG can easily be shown to be recursively unsolvable. A particularly interesting application of this method gives an affirmative answer to Flannaganu0027s [1985] conjecture that the floundering property for queries with respect to MU-PROLOG programs is undecidable.
